title: A survey of interlayer interaction models for graphene and other 2D materials
summary: This work presents a survey of mechanical models describing van der Waals interactions between 2D materials, encompassing both continuous elastomer-like materials and discrete (crystalline) 2D materials such as graphene. These interactions give rise to a range of physical phenomena, including contact instabilities, Moiré patterns, surface reconstructions, and superlubricity.
